Today we're reintroducing the #EqualityAct. My hope is every LGBTQ American who's been bullied or discriminated against, knows that in the halls of Congress – we👁️you, we👂🏼you, we❤️you. 

This bill isn't demanding special treatment – it's demanding equal justice under law.

In 2007, Kenneth Lee defended laws that prohibit people from voting if they've been convicted of a crime - which we already know disenfranchises Black voters at higher rates. Today I asked him about this. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D1jz8JLX4AYClEE.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1105901131228766215/vid/320x180/S1CSOH60--drtOt6.mp4?tag=11

LGBTQ Americans face real discrimination on the job, in our schools, and when trying to find and pay for a home. That needs to end. The EQUALITY Act would ensure members of the LGBTQ community are protected from discrimination nationwide. We must pass it.

It is Congress who decides if and when the U.S. goes to war, not the president. For far too long Congress has abdicated that responsibility. Today that must end. Today the Senate must vote to stop supporting the Saudi-led war in Yemen, where 85,000 children have starved to death.
